intro: Phymatodes ebenipes, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Phymatodes ebenipes plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
